text: Schouskjelleren Ølfestiva 2016. Dark brown body with a short beige head. Aorma of flowery hops and roasted malt, taste is semisweet with caramel, nuts, flowers, light chocolate notes. Bitterness comes in finish, leaving a fresh and sweet aftertaste.
Brown, medium head, fruity aroma, caramel, roast, fruits, butter, fruity flavor, roast, caramel, butter, medium bodied.

Sample at Danske Ölentusiaster Festival 2015. Clear dark Amber/brown beer with a nice lasting beige head. Malty caramel aroma, mash, hay, herbal notes. Malty caramel flavor, raisins, caramel, floral notes, hay, some herbal notes. Quite ok.
On tap. Pours black with a creamy off white head. Aroma is malty and hoppy. Citric notes. Lovely hoppy and roasted flavor. Great.

[5/3/15] Draught at Taphouse in Copenhagen. Dark brown with a beige head. Aroma of malt, toast, caramel and nice smokiness. Sweetish flavor with malt, toast, smokiness and a mild bitterish finish. Medium-bodied.

Draught @ Søernes Ølbar, Copenhagen. Pours dark brown with a creamy tan head, lacngs. Aroma of malt, caramel, dark chocolate, light fruit. Flavor is malty, caramel, chocolate, little dark fruits. Medium body, average carbonation, dry finish. 020515

Tap at the Taphouse, Copenhagen. Poured a clear medium brown witth a frothy light tan head. The aroma is dry veggie skunky malt. The flavour is moderate bitter with a liqourice hop spice bitter palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.
Poured deep reddish brown with a small tan head. Aroma of sweet fruit and caramel malt. Medium body, flavour is medium sweet, lightly bitter.

Draft at Taphouse. Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of roast, malt, grassy hops, fruits and a little dark chocolate. Flavor is moderate sweet and over moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Copenhagen 

Pours dark brown, almost black with a foamy white head. Aroma of roasty, hoppy and grassy with some coffee and earthy notes. Taste is smooth, hoppy and slightly roasty with some licorice, coffee, chocolate and cocoa. Finish is smooth, hoppy and slightly roasty. Smooth and balanced.
Draught @ Fermentoren. Aroma has sweet fruity tones, licorice and resin. Flavour has strong licorice tones, resiny hops and some coffee. Feels like Black IPA. Delicious.
Draft @ Fermentoren, CPH. Pours Dark Brown with a small creamy head. Chewy malty. Fruity and bitter. Caramel, bread, nuts and grassy hops. Smooth. Some peachy hops. Good!
Tap at soernes.. Deep red black.. Thick tan head... Soft zezty piine.. And chocolate roast nose.. Dark roast. Dark fruits.. Chocolate roast. dark malts.. Rich roast

Aroma and taste is sweet malty, medium roasted, some caramel, chocolate, bitter finish.

Keg at SBWF.  Dark brown, beige head. Coffee and grapefruit up front. Mid sweet with medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Concentrated flavours of coffee, licorice, mango and grapefruit. Long bitter finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Black colour, small brown head. Aroma is fruity, floral, mildly roasted along with some syrupy notes. Flavour is ashy, some roasted malts, earth, mild sweet maltiness as well as a quite bitter finish.
Tap at SBWF2014. Dark brown color, toasted, woody aroma. Medium-bodied. Toasted, some licorice. Lingering light bitterness.

Copenhagen Ølfestival 2014. Very dark brown with a lasting off-white head. Fruity aroma with citrus hops and some roasted notes. Sweet, malty flavour with roasted and citrus notes, and a rather bitter finish

Draught @ Fermentoren, Halmtorvet 29 c, Copenhagen, Denmark 1700. [ As Flying Couch Black Bitter Bajer ].Clear medium to dark brown color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, hay, dark malt, light roasted, moderate hoppy, grass. Flavour is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration, hay - grass, roasted, light chocolate, toffee notes. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20140503]
DØE. Clear dark brown with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel and moderate hoppy - citrus. Flavor is quite sweet and rather bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 230514

Draft @ Ølfestival 2014. Pours a dark amber brown color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty weak hoppy caramel aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter caramel flavor. Has a fruity malty caramel hoppy finish with weak hints of licorice.
Draught at KØ14. Mild hoppy aroma. Cloudy very dark brown colour. Small stable tan head. The flavour is nicely hoppy slightly sweet. Grassy and caramelly.
Nose is mediumheavy walnut, some cake, celery, green pepper, feel is mediumbroad, taste is menthol, leaves, weak damp clothes, green beans, late decent hops bite

200ml on tap at Fermentoren, shared with Skinnyviking. Moderate, bubbly beige coloured head resting on top of a cloudy, ruby-red coloured body. Dusty hops and semi-sweet malts on the nose. Malt-fruity taste of cocoa, earth and herbs. Nice round off with leafy hops. Medium bodied. Pleasing (Copenhagen 03.05.2014).

Tap @ Fermentoren. Pours a deep brown color with a small lasting white head. Aroma is of malt and hops. Taste is of lightly roasted malt, caramel, nuts, a whole lot of chocolate and hops. Long bitter chocolate-y aftertaste. Above medium body and average carbonation. Pretty good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Dark reddish shade with a pale brown head. Lacing also. Smells hoppy in a piney and floral way. Taste is hoppy again with brown sugar and toasty malts. Tastes like a cross between a black IPA and a brown ale, and maybe even an amber. But knowing what it is, I have to say that its well executed.

Draft. A brown beer with a lazing tan head. The aroma has notes of citrusy hops, bread, and caramel. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, bread, and caramel, as well as hints of alcohol, leading to a bitter finish.
Draught. Low fluffy white lasting head. Very dark brown almost black body. Mild roasted malt caramel flavor. Fair amount of hops bitterness. Low carbonation. Long finish.

Tap @ Fermentoren.
Pours dark red color with a medium sized creamy head. Chocolate, malts and dark fruits. Chocolaty flavor as well, some toffee and grainy malts. Nice creamy palate and not too sweet.
3414

Fermentoren, Copenhagen, Dk.
Tap, 260913.
Brown with beige head. Aroma of malt and hop spices. Flavor with caramel and nuts.
Sample at SBWF 2013. Flowery and fruity with some freshly cut flowers or similar. Dark malty and bready taste with some fruits.

Tap @ Lord Nelson, Cph. Pours deep brown with a small, creamy, off-white head. Aroma has caramel, toasted, light dark chocolate, dusty. Medium carbonation, fine dry and light mouthfeel. Flavour is quite dusty, some coffee and cocoa. Lingering malty dry finish. A bit over the top.
Pitch dark small light brown head flavor is mild roasted malty very dry and very nice quenching

@ SBWF 2013. Mycket trevlig och fyllig doft med tydliga brända toner och söt lakrits. Tjock vätska med fin balans. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

At SBWF 2013

Hazy brownish with a small head. Aroma and taste of fruit, light roasted malt, citrus and grass. The finish was on the dry side and fairly bitter.

Draught at Søerne Ølbar. Black with a small off-white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, fruit, cacao and grasdy notes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ Søernes Ølbar, MashUp. Pours unclear red/brown with a minimal bubbly off-white head. Aroma is coffee, hard roasted malt,pine, licorice and grass. Taste is light sweet, moderate bitter and light acidic. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. Finishes bitter.

Draught at Søernes Ølbar - Mash-Up Sunday. Cloudy brown - white head.
Roasted. Dried fruity. Light smokey. Light yeasty. Ok bitterness. Grassy. Pine needles. Resin. Cocoa powder.
On tap at Søernes. Pours a hazy dark brown with a small off-white head. Dry and hoppy. Hoppy aromas of spruce and some citrus fruits. Medium bodied. Soft to medium carbonation. Bitter finish.

Draught at Mash-Up at Søernes Ølbar.
Hazy orange-red coloured with a small off-white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, cocoa powder and grass with notes of pine needles.
Fruity flavour of hops, grass and grapefruits with roasted notes.
Dry hoppy finish.
From tap. Pours hazy brown with a small tan head. Toasted malty, grapefruity, citrusy. Smooth fruity and smooth fruity. Smooth fruity and crisp hoppy. Bitter and toasted malty.
On tap, at Mash Up, Søernes Ølbar. Murky reddish brown with a small beige head. Sweet fruity hoppy nose. Minty. Light roast, light biscuit notes. Clean and sharply bitter finish. High drinkabillity.
